thread.title: Icahn Takes Active Stake in Cheniere, Seeks Management Talks
thread.title_full: Icahn Takes Active Stake in Cheniere, Seeks Management Talks - Bloomberg Business

author: David Marino
title: Icahn Takes Active Stake in Cheniere, Seeks Management Talks
text:
Billionaire investor Carl Icahn reported a new 8.18 percent activist stake in Cheniere Energy Inc. and plans to seek talks with the natural gas company’s management and perhaps board seats “if appropriate.”
Icahn believes Cheniere’s shares are undervalued and will seek discussions on “operations, capital expenditures, financings and executive compensation,” according to a 13D regulatory filing Thursday. No talks have happened yet.
Cheniere is building what will be the first export facility for shale gas in the U.S. Icahn, 79, rebranded as an activist investor and outspoken shareholder advocate after gaining fame as a corporate raider in the 1980s. His Icahn Associates Corp. has recently taken large stakes in companies including Apple Inc., Netflix Inc., Manitowoc Co. and Gannett Co., agitating for shareholder-enriching changes. In May, he led a surprising venture cap investment in car-hailing service Lyft Inc.
The New York-based investor is worth more than $21 billion, according to Bloomberg Billionaires, and primarily invests his own fortune, rather than relying on money from outsiders.
Activist investors buy equity stakes in publicly traded companies and push executives and directors to make changes they argue will boost shareholder returns.
